website_summaries.verdict: Ion plans to add alert functionality to its Ion the Home camera eventually; in the meantime, you'll have to monitor your live feed 24/7 to get any real security benefits.
pros: Ion's $130, £150 Ion the Home security camera is an entry-level camera with a free cloud storage option
cons: Its Android and iOS apps aren't currently able to send push or email alerts -- a huge problem if you want to use your Ion the Home camera for real-time security-related notifications

customer_reviews.title: It appears they are abandoning the product
customer_reviews.text: I've been using 3 of these cameras for a few years now and for the last year or so they have worked well but as of about May 2020 all three cameras quit working. From the blinking lights they are able to access the WIFI but not the ION server. I tried several times to re- program them with no results. There is no customer support. I found a contact method which acknowledges your note but no one responds. It appears their server went belly up and no one is fixing it. I don't understand how they can still be for sale but I recommend you not waste your money and look for another solution. (besides ION the home)

Quick turnaround time getting the firmware updated. If you have a 5g network,you may need to turn it off. This camera requires the 2.4g network.

I use my camera to periodically check on my dog and it works wonderfully. I don't have any need to store footage so there is no monthly or annual cost to me. There is a night vision option that works wonderfully and does come in handy during low-light situations.
